result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason J Hegemann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason J Hegemann in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Charlotte Lacey.
Matter was scheduled for Jury trial.
Matter is now resolved.
On a plea to count 1 in 13CT1299, state moves to DRI all other charges.
Plea - Ct.1 - G.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.    Ct.2 - DRI.    15CM799 - DRI.
apply bond from 15CM799 to case 13CT1299.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason J Hegemann in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
Matter is scheduled for Trial in July.
BTC: Leave matter as set for trial.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***DEFT HAS UNTIL 5PM TODAY 3-30-15 TO POST BOND, FAILURE TO POST, DEFT MUST REPORT TO RCJ***  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jason J Hegemann in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
